Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the event by stating that Hillary Clinton was killed when she was hit by an out-of-control truck. This is not true and has been confirmed as a fabricated story.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks any credible evidence or support to back up the assertion that Hillary Clinton was killed in a truck accident.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Hillary Clinton is alive and well, as confirmed by various sources.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the information provided by the website Daily World Update is true, without questioning its credibility or fact-checking.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in this claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters in terms of accuracy and reliability, as it is based on a fabricated story from a fake news website.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation given in the claim, as it presents a false narrative of Hillary Clinton's death.
